bug-trace.comment: call L4659 recursively, causing a stack overflow.
note that file will be copied to syms at syms.c:821
copy csymbols to syms, byte by byte
*minisymsp = syms; in nm.c:1113's view, minisyms is assigned.
syminfo.name is sym->name, thanks to line syms.c:765
The last letter of name is '@'. Change it to '\0'. `name` will later be assigned to di->n.
Inside the macro, since *(di->n) is '_', adds 1 to di->n.
Inside the macro, since *(di->n) is 'Z', adds 1 to di->n.
Adds 1 to di->n. This is repeately referenced by d_peek_char in L2422.
Since the file has too many 'P's (see poc), execution loops cplus_demangle_type too many times. When the stack trace is full, the error crashes.
note that file will be copied to syms at syms.c:821
copy csymbols to syms, byte by byte
*minisymsp = syms; in nm.c:1113's view, minisyms is assigned.
syminfo.name is sym->name, thanks to line syms.c:765
The last letter of name is '@'. Change it to '\0'. `name` will later be assigned to di->n.
Inside the macro, since *(di->n) is '_', adds 1 to di->n.
Inside the macro, since *(di->n) is 'Z', adds 1 to di->n.
d_next_char is a macro that adds 1 to di->n, and returns *(di->n).
d_check_char does d_peek_char (as L2422), and adds 1 to di->n. Since *(di->n) is `F`, the execution can advance to L2856.
Number 1 is passed as a second parameter. Hence, the execution can advance to L2932.

Since the file has too many 'F's (see poc), execution loops betweeen three functions (cplus_demangle_type, d_function_type, d_bare_function_type) too many times. Each callsite is L2443, L2856, and L2932.

Inside the macro, since *(di->n) is '_', adds 1 to di->n.
Inside the macro, since *(di->n) is 'Z', adds 1 to di->n.
Since the file has too many 'Z's (see poc), execution loops betweeen three functions (d_name, d_local_name, d_encoding) too many times. When the stack trace is full, the error crashes.

Inside the macro, since *(di->n) is '_', adds 1 to di->n.
Inside the macro, since *(di->n) is 'Z', adds 1 to di->n.
L2422:peek =*((di)->n). Since peek is case 'M', we reach L2458
d_check_char does d_peek_char (as L2422), and adds 1 to di->n
Since the file has too many 'M's (see poc), execution loops between two functions cplus_demangle_type and d_pointer_to_member_type too many times. Each callsite is L2458 and L3039.
note that file will be copied to syms at syms.c:821
copy csymbols to syms, byte by byte
*minisymsp = syms; in nm.c:1113's view, minisyms is assigned.
syminfo.name is sym->name, thanks to line syms.c:765
The last letter of name is '@'. Change it to '\0'.
Inside the macro, since *(di->n) is '_', adds 1 to di->n.
Inside the macro, since *(di->n) is 'Z', adds 1 to di->n.
L2387's condition evaluates to true since peek == 'K' in L2291
Advances di->n until condition in L2714 evaulates to 0. In POC, di->n eventually reaches where *(di->n) equals 'U'.
Macro to add 1 to di->n. In POC, after U comes consecutive I's.

Since the file has too many 'I's (see poc), execution loops between three functions (d_template_args_1, d_template_arg, d_template_args) too many times. When the stack trace is full, the error crashes.
